Visionary.description: You are a Visionary innovator — drawn to bold, future-shaping ideas and emerging possibilities. You see what could exist long before others do.
strengths: Naturally imagines future states and long-term possibilities
Comfortable with ambiguity and early-stage, high-uncertainty ideas
Energised by exploring new concepts and reframing problems
Inspires others with compelling visions and narratives
risks: May underinvest in implementation and operational detail
Can generate more ideas than can realistically be executed
Risk of losing interest once an idea moves into routine delivery
May underestimate practical constraints such as budget or capacity

Architect.description: You are an Architect innovator — a systems thinker who brings structure, rigour, and stability to turning ideas into robust realities.
strengths: Excellent at designing repeatable systems, processes, and frameworks
Strong follow-through from concept to implementation
Balances innovation with reliability, compliance, and quality
Able to translate vision into roadmaps, milestones, and standards
risks: May prefer proven methods over experimental approaches
Can slow down ideation if structure is imposed too early
Risk of overengineering solutions before validating assumptions
May find highly chaotic or rapidly changing environments draining

Trailblazer.description: You are a Trailblazer innovator — you move fast, test boldly, and push into uncharted territory through rapid experimentation.
strengths: High bias towards action and experimentation
Comfortable taking calculated risks and making quick decisions
Excellent at building momentum and testing ideas in the real world
Thrives in early-stage, fast-moving innovation contexts
risks: May overlook deeper analysis, validation, or documentation
Can leave teams behind if pace and change are too intense
Risk of burnout if constantly pushing into new territory
May pivot too often without fully extracting value from wins

Strategist.description: You are a Strategist innovator — you connect ideas to markets, models, and positioning. You think in terms of value, fit, and long-term advantage.
strengths: Thinks clearly about market fit, differentiation, and positioning
Considers financial, operational, and policy realities early
Strong at prioritising ideas based on impact and feasibility
Acts as a bridge between technical teams and decision-makers
risks: May appear cautious or slow to commit without enough data
Can deprioritise radical ideas that look risky on paper
Risk of over-analysing and delaying experiments
May be perceived as ‘commercialising’ too early by creative teams

Maker.description: You are a Maker innovator — you think with your hands. You build, prototype, test, and refine through tangible outputs.
strengths: Excellent at turning abstract ideas into working prototypes
Learns quickly through hands-on iteration and experimentation
Brings practical constraints and real-world performance into view
Comfortable with tools, technology, and implementation details
risks: May focus on building without stepping back for strategic fit
Can underestimate the importance of communication and storytelling
Risk of perfectionism in the prototype or technical details
May delay involving users or stakeholders until later than ideal

Synthesizer.description: You are a Synthesizer innovator — you bring people, ideas, and disciplines together to create integrated, cross-cutting solutions.
strengths: Connects diverse perspectives into coherent solutions
Collaborates effectively across disciplines and functions
Sees interdependencies, systems, and second-order effects
Strong at facilitation, co-creation, and alignment-building
risks: May spend too much time aligning stakeholders before acting
Risk of avoiding conflict by over-accommodating different views
Can feel stretched when pulled between many domains
May struggle in contexts that reward narrow, individual ownership
